Pre-Game Insights: The Zambia vs Tanzania game is expected to be an exciting show that will captivate fans all over the continent.
The head-to-head matches between both frequently have surprising turns, capturing the spirit of what makes African football so exciting.
Kick-off is scheduled for Sunday, 21st January 2024, 05:00 PM GMT; 10:30 PM IST at Stade de San Pédro.
Zambia's recent form in all competitions is W-W-L-D-D.
Tanzania's recent form in all competitions is D-W-L-L-L.
Players to watch for Zambia include Kings Kangwa, a creative striker known for his agility and ability to create scoring opportunities.
Players to watch for Tanzania include Charles M’Mombwa, a flexible player who can play in midfield or attack and has been a regular scorer for Tanzania.
Zambia have drawn one game while Tanzania have lost one game in the AFCON 2023.
On their last meeting, Zambia won by 2 goals.
The average number of goals in meetings between Zambia and Tanzania is 3.33.
Currently, in the second game of the group stage in AFCON, Zambia have no injuries or suspensions.
Tanzania's squad dynamics are affected by Miyoshi’s suspension and Allarakhia’s injury.
Predicted lineup for Zambia (4-4-2): Mulenga; Phiri, Sunzu, Mwape, Musonda; Kapumbu, Mafwenta, Kangwa, Banda; Daka, Sakala.
Predicted lineup for Tanzania (4-3-3): Manula; Dickson, Nondo, Mnoga, Miroshi; Msuva, Hamad, Bajana; Samatta, M’Mombwa, Salum.
